data.title: Facebook considers action to ensure Bloomberg posts made by Bloomberg employees
data.text: Presidential candidate Michael Bloomberg has already spent $40 million on traditional campaign advertising. CNBC's Julia Boorstin reports on what the campaign is doing on non-traditional platforms.

data.title: Why Facebook (FB) Stock Fell Monday.
data.text: The social network is getting slammed, along with other stocks, over coronavirus fears.

data.title: Facebook’s Creator Studio gains a mobile companion
data.text: Facebook’s Creator Studio has added a mobile companion. The insights dashboard for creators and publishers, which debuted globally in August 2018, is now available as a mobile app for both iOS and Android.

data.title: Facebook: Expenses Have Bottomed, 2020 Returns Ahead
data.text: Facebook: Expenses Have Bottomed, 2020 Returns Ahead

data.title: Coronavirus plunge wipes more than $200 billion from Big Tech stocks
data.text: Altogether, Apple, Facebook, Amazon, Microsoft and Google, six of the most valuable U.S. companies, lost over $200 billion.

data.title: It’s Time to Pull the Plug on Facebook Stock
data.text: Several Facebook executives are selling their shares of FB stock, which is near all-time highs but facing the threat of costly regulation.
